content:
/>
XIII.ii.1.A.2.c
.
Veterans With Claims Folders That Are Unavailable
Use the table below to determine the actions an RO must take when it receives a request for medical evidence from SSA but the corresponding paper claims folder is unavailable.
If the claims folder is …
Then the RO must …
located at another RO
annotate the cover letter that accompanied
Form SSA-827
with the name and location of the RO that has custody of the claims folder, and
return the cover letter and
Form SSA-827
to the SSA office that sent it.
on temporary transfer to VA Central Office
send the
Form SSA-827
and cover letter that accompanied it to the service within VA Central Office that has possession of the folder.
Note
:  The service having possession of the folder is responsible for processing the request.
on temporary transfer to the Board of Veterans Appeals
send the
Form SSA-827
and cover letter that accompanied it to the Director of Compensation Service (211B) for processing.
title: M21-1, Part XIII, Subpart ii, Chapter 1, Section A - Social Security Administration (SSA) Requests for Medical Evidence
citation: Part XIII, Subpart ii, Chapter 1, Section A
